Hello, my name is Ryan!

I'm a web specialist building web content and code for CIRO - Canada's regulator protecting investors and capital markets.

This is my basecamp on the internet. Thanks for dropping by! I've put a short story about myself if you would like to read on below.

YYZ

A little background - I am born and raised in Toronto and have never left the city. Growing up I wanted to be an architect and after discovering graphic design, wireframing and coding, I have been on this path of exploring the web. Instead of learning the tools to design city buildings and structures, I have equipped myself to learn semantic HTML, CSS and JavaScript to build websites.

That said, I do appreciate city architecture and have curated photos overtime in my wanderings in Toronto and outside the city with my Fujifilm x100F.

If you are interested, you can check out the gallery.

Long Life Learning

I thought university was about learning as much to then land the perfect career role. Instead I can only look back to one of my favourite courses (ITM740) where I was tasked to create wireframes and a prototype for a restaurant-booking mobile app. Creating pitchdecks and collaborating with other students for this project was an unforgettable experience.

A recording of the prototype made from Adobe XD still lives on the web, watch the video.

After graduation, I've taken more courses related to research, web design and development and continue to create projects to apply what I have learned over the years.

Frontend Development

At the core - I am always looking to learn more about the tools to serve others on the web. I have discovered the growing demand for websites, the maintenance that comes with content management systems and appreciate web building platforms, but I have grown more curious about the engine under the hood and look to learn more about front-end development.

If you are interested, you can check out the gallery.
